name: 運動贊助策略研究
goals: To understand the fundaments of modern sport sponsorship and its importance of strategic applications in global sport business.
To cultivate students ability of developing the effective sport sponsorship proposal and the ability to work with others (team work).
To develop the essential capability of being an outstanding modern global sport industry leader who is able to deal with various challenges and issues successfully in the sport world.
syllabus:
Week 1: Introducing the course of strategic sport sponsorship.

Week 2: Understanding the concepts of sport  sponsorship I: Developments and trends. 

Week 3: Understanding the concepts of sport  sponsorship II: Benefits and win-win situation.

Week 4: Study on the integrated sport sponsorship strategy: Global case of Samsung Olympic marketing

Week 5: Sponsorship in the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games I: Overview of international and local brands marketing.

Week 6: Sponsorship in the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games II: Ambush marketing and sponsorship activation

Week 7: Guest Speech: Ms. Vivian H.C. Chien, Manager of Public affairs and Communications, Swire Coca-Cola Beverages LTD., Taiwan Branch  

Week 8: Individual Athlete sponsorship: Sport celebrity endorsement; Evaluating sponsorship effects (ROI)

Week 9: Field case study: Group oral reports.

Week 10: Guest Speech: Mr. Larry Cheng, Former General Manager of New Balance & Nike, Taiwan.  Chief Consultant, Well Fantastic CO. LTD.

Week 11: Developing sport sponsorship plan.

Week 12: Discussing the cases of sponsorship plan. 

Week 13: Guest Speech: Mr. John Edward Caraccio, GM, World Gym Taiwan.

Week 14: Final oral presentations: Sport sponsorship proposal I

Week 15: Final oral presentations: Sport sponsorship proposal  III

Week 16: Conclusion

Week 17: Cases review and study  on the web.

Week 18: Cases review and study  on the web.

methodologies.note: Topics, cases discussion and sponsorship plan
Field trips of sport sponsorship activities
Strategic sponsorship cases of Samsung and Coca-Cola

grading.note: Final oral presentation of sport sponsorship proposal

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
